meanings.definition: A person who practices severe self-discipline and abstains from indulgence.
meanings.sent1: The ascetics in the monastery lived a simple life focused on self-discipline.
meanings.sent2: Many ascetics choose to live in solitude to better practice self-discipline.
meanings.sent3: The ascetics decided to have a potluck, but only served plain rice and water.
meanings.sent4: Her room was as bare as an ascetic's cell, with only a mat on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The ascetics' dedication to self-discipline was as unwavering as a mountain.

meanings.definition: The principles and practices of self-denial and austerity.
meanings.sent1: Studying the ascetics of ancient times can teach us about self-denial.
meanings.sent2: The ascetics of that religion follow strict rules of austerity.
meanings.sent3: The ascetics' idea of a feast was a single piece of bread shared among them.
meanings.sent4: The ascetics' commitment to austerity was like a beacon of light in a world of excess.
meanings.sent5: The ascetics' lifestyle of self-denial was a testament to their inner strength.
